task_summary: The robot's task is to reach a towel placed on the workspace, guided by perception and approach actions, as evidenced in the episode frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a bimanual xArm robot positioned above a workspace containing a towel to be reached. The robot starts above the workspace and proceeds by visually detecting the towel, approaching it accurately, and aligning itself for contact, without an explicit grasp. The movement is deliberate, and object localization is periodically verified. The workspace is clear, and the towel is distinct against the background. There are no visible obstacles, but correct spatial perception and control are required.
preconditions: Robot arms are powered and home position is set.
Towel is present and distinctly visible on workspace.
Sensors for perception and motion are functional.
stepwise_plan: Check if the towel is visible.
If not detected, scan workspace for the towel up to 3 times.
Detect precise location of the towel.
Move robot end-effector above the towel to a safe height.
Approach and align with the towel using tight tolerance.
success_criteria: Robot end-effector is precisely positioned over the towel within allowed tolerance.
No collisions with workspace or towel.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect towel: retry scan sequence.
Perception noise: fall back to repeated scanning and approach.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when the robot is aligned over the towel with required precision and timeout elapsed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is currently visible to sensors.
Scans workspace in a grid pattern up to 3 times to find the towel.
Triggers object recognition to locate the precise position of the towel.
Moves the arm above the towel at a safe vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns the end-effector over the towel with high precision.
Waits briefly at goal pose to stabilize or confirm completion.

failure_modes: MoveAbove fails to reach safe z offset
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if towel is not visible
If approach fails, repeat movement sequence
Fallback detection in case of workspace occlusion
assumptions: Instruction does not specify grasp; frames show only reaching without contact manipulation.
No grasp or place phases observed; BT omits Pick/Place actions.
Workspace is clear per frames; only one object (towel) relevant.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector over towel, no collisions, alignment within tolerance
